Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic, perhaps black-figured, pottery Gordion cup; interior glazed black with reserved band at tooled junction with lip; exterior: lip glazed; bands at top and bottom of otherwise reserved handle zone; glazed below; incised inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1948,0815.6, 1948,0815.7 and 1948,0815.8. The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 42. Compare to Kleitias (ABV, 79, middle). Beazley Archive 300745.
